rComments: Hoover's alright.. She's pretty young! She really was just very mediocre. Homework was pretty easy, tests not as easy. I had to go to MSI to get more help but ended up with an A- in the class. It's an average class :p

She's really nice, but an absolutely terrible professor. Sometimes she would write down the formulas wrong and I would try and use them on my homework and end up failing the homework and she wouldn't excuse it! However, the tests are open note and pretty easy so if you study and know how to use the formulas you're good to go

Merrit is really nice and tries to help but I found the class extremely frustrating and confusing.  Math is one of better subjects but we didn't use a textbook AT ALL so there were NO practice problems--very frustrating experience.  I hope to take it again with a different professor.

Merrit is a good teacher and I really liked her class. Tests were open notes and only required a scientific calculator. The assignments were very fun. I got to learn how to use the computer program R. I would recommend her for Psych 181. Even though it might seem intimidating Merrit makes it a smooth ride.

Possibly one of the worst professors I have ever had. Dressed like a 19 year old, said frequently that she didnt know how to do math (which was apparent), used stupid pointless examles, never answered questions, etc. etc. if you are taking for a lower div psych req, im sorry. you wont learn a thing.PS, dont buy the book!

WORST CLASS EVER. Merrit purposefully keeps you in the dark. You have no idea what is expected of you! No textbook or rubric prior to doing the homework.  You are suppose to analyze the data but no one (not the TAs or MSI) will give you examples and instruct you what to say and how to interpret the results. Frustrating. Confusing, Unproductive.

Professor Hoover seemed nice. Lectures were all right. The examples given were helpful. I bombed the first two tests. I aced the final. Sections helped a little, extra practice. I recommend going to MSI. She said the textbook was required, but she provides the formulas and charts needed.

the class goes kind of slow at first and then speeds up. make sure to attend class and section and msi if needed. if you persistently get help, you'll be fine. the tests were open note/textbook so that helped a lot. it was generally an easy class

good teacher, she tries her best and knows stats very well. I HATE her examples of date they were just too much and long.ATTEND EVERY CLASS. It moves very fast. I went to classes and MSI 3 times a week and still felt behind. Math is my weakest subject, I wouldnt recommend taking her course, but plus side, all the tests were open note/book.

It's always great to have an instructor that's as straightforward as Merrit. Three exams, each worth 25%, as well as 25% for extremely easy "lab" assignments. Lecture are incredibly interesting. All of you psychology majors that don't like cognitive psych should seriously consider taking this course with her. It'll change your opinion of the field.

One of the worst professors I've ever had.  Her knowledge of statistics was poor, she marked me off for the way I solved problems, even if I got the correct answer... Completely useless, cannot contact... She shouldn't be teaching... AVOID HER AT ALL COSTS!

I liked this class. The only reason I didn't get an A was because I never went to section, so learn from me and go. As long as you go to class and pay attention you should do fine on the test (all essay format).
Merrit was a good teacher--I feel like she did her best with the dry material that is statistics.  She was easy on the eyes at least!  Tests were fair.

Merrit is soooo good. This class was very easy, but not because we didn't learn anything. She made it so easy to understand the material that when it came time to take the test, I'd barely have to study because I had already learned it all in class. Go to every class and pay attention and you should have no trouble at all.

Merrit was great. She went out of her way to make the subject matter interesting and understandable. I enjoyed going to lectures, which was good because the material from every lecture was used in the tests. Tests are short answer and she gives a pretty good review sheet. She is extremely knowledgeable and you can tell she loves this subject.
